description: Complex analysis treats the calculus of complex-valued functions of a complex variable. Familiar words and ideas from ordinary calculus (limit, derivative, integral, maximum and minimum, infinite series) reappear in the complex setting. Topics include complex mappings, derivatives, and integrals; applications focus especially on the physical sciences. Prerequisite: Mathematics 220, and Mathematics 226 or 244. Offered annually.
name: Complex Analysis
prerequisites: Mathematics 220, and Mathematics 226 or 244. Offered annually.

revisions.prerequisites: Prerequisite: Mathematics 220, and Mathematics 226 or 244. Offered annually.
